qas.question: What did France retain in India?

answers.text: returned all the French trading ports

qas.question: How were the French settlements changed to eliminate their military usefulness?

answers.text: treaty, however, required that the fortifications of these settlements be destroyed and never rebuilt

qas.question: What French ally in the area abandoned the French?

answers.text: loss of France's ally in Bengal
the defection of Hyderabad to the British

qas.question: What happened to French power in the area?

answers.text: this effectively brought French power in India to an end

context: In India, the British retained the Northern Circars, but <a0_0>returned all the French trading ports<a0_0/>. The <a1_0>treaty, however, required that the fortifications of these settlements be destroyed and never rebuilt<a1_0/>, while only minimal garrisons could be maintained there, thus rendering them worthless as military bases. Combined with the <a2_0>loss of France's ally in Bengal<a2_0/> and <a3_0>the defection of Hyderabad to the British<a3_0/> as a result of the war, <a4_0>this effectively brought French power in India to an end<a4_0/>, making way for British hegemony and eventual control of the subcontinent.
